00040 char nToChar(int n, bool upperCase) {
00041     if (n < 10) return char(n+'0');
00042     else if (upperCase) return char((n - 10) + 'A');
00043     else return char((n - 10) + 'a');
00044 }
00045 
00046 } // namespace

00048 namespace core {
00049 
00050 std::string to_string(const integer& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00051     if (base<2 || base>36) throw invalid_base();
00052 
00053     if (n.sign()==0) return "0";
00054 
00055     std::ostringstream out;
00056     if (base==16) {
00057         // Special no-division version, primarily for debugging division
00058         const data_t *ndata=n._get_data();
00059         const digit_t *firstDigit=ndata->digits,
00060             *lastDigit=firstDigit + ndata->mLength - 1;
00061 
00062         const int bitsPerDigit=4;
00063         const digit_t mask=(doubledigit_t(1) << bitsPerDigit)-1;
00064 
00065         // Suppress any leading zeros
00066         const digit_t *d=lastDigit;
00067         int digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00068         while (digitShift >= 0 && ((*d >> digitShift) & mask) == 0)
00069             digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00070 
00071         do {
00072             while (digitShift >= 0) {
00073                 out << nToChar((*d >> digitShift) & mask, uppercase);
00074                 digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00075             }
00076 
00077             digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00078         } while (d-- != firstDigit);
00079 
00080         std::string r(n.sign() < 0 ? std::string("-")+out.str() : out.str());
00081         return r;
00082     } else {
00083         const integer shift=base;
00084         std::pair<integer, integer> a=std::make_pair(n, integer::zero());
00085         a.first._set_negative(false);
00086 
00087         integer r;
00088         while (a.first.sign()!=0) {
00089             a=divide_r(a.first, shift);
00090             out << nToChar(a.second._get_digit(0), uppercase);
00091         }
00092 
00093         if (n.sign() < 0) out << '-';
00094 
00095         std::string rval=out.str();
00096         std::reverse(rval.begin(), rval.end());
00097         return rval;
00098     }
00099 }
00100 
00101 integer from_string(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00102     bool negate=false;
00103     const char *c=str.c_str();
00104     if (*c=='+') ++c;
00105     else if (*c=='-') { negate=true; ++c; }
00106 
00107     if (base==autobase) {
00108         if (*c=='0') {
00109             ++c;
00110             if (*c=='x' || *c=='X') {
00111                 ++c;
00112                 base=16;
00113             } else base=8;
00114         } else base=10;
00115     }
00116 
00117     if (base<2 || base>36) throw invalid_base();
00118     if (*c==0) throw invalid_digit("No valid digits");
00119 
00120     const integer shift(base);
00121 
00122     integer r;
00123     while (*c) {
00124         unsigned int digit;
00125         if (*c>='0' && *c<='9') digit=*c-'0';
00126         else if (*c>='A' && *c<='Z') digit=*c-'A'+10;
00127         else if (*c>='a' && *c<='z') digit=*c-'a'+10;
00128         else throw invalid_digit("encountered non-alphanumeric character in "
00129             "string");
00130 
00131         if (digit >= base) throw invalid_digit("encountered digit greater than "
00132             "base allows");
00133 
00134         r = (r * shift) + digit;
00135         ++c;
00136     }
00137     r._set_negative(negate);
00138     return r;
00139 }
00140 
00141 integer from_binary(const std::string& str) {
00142     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00143     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00144 
00145     integer r;
00146     detail::data_t *rdata=r._get_data();
00147     rdata->alloc((str.length() + bytesPerDigit - 1)/bytesPerDigit);
00148     digit_t *p=rdata->digits;
00149 
00150     unsigned char *s=(unsigned char *)str.data(), *se=s+str.length();
00151     while (s<se) {
00152         digit_t d=0;
00153         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit && s<se; ++i)
00154             d |= (digit_t(*s++) << (i * bitsPerByte));
00155         *p++=d;
00156     }
00157     rdata->skipLeadingZeros();
00158     return r;
00159 }
00160 
00161 std::string to_binary(const integer& n) {
00162     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00163     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00164     std::vector<unsigned char> temp;
00165     temp.reserve(n._get_length() * bytesPerDigit);
00166 
00167     const detail::data_t *ndata=n._get_data();
00168     const digit_t *p=ndata->digits, *pe=p+n._get_length();
00169     while (p != pe) {
00170         digit_t d(*p++);
00171         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit; ++i) {
00172             temp.push_back((unsigned char)(d));
00173             d >>= bitsPerByte;
00174         }
00175     }
00176     while (!temp.empty() && temp.back()==0) temp.pop_back();
00177     char *c=(char*)&temp[0];
00178     return std::string(c, c+temp.size());
00179 }

00204 std::string to_string(const integer& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00205     try {
00206         return to_string(core::integer(n), base, uppercase);
00207     } catch (exception&) {
00208         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw;
00209         else return std::string();
00210     }
00211 }

00239 integer from_string(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00240     try {
00241         if (str==detail::nan_text) return integer::nan();
00242         return integer(core::from_string(str, base));
00243     } catch (std::exception&) {
00244         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw;
00245         else return integer::nan();
00246     }
00247 }
00248 
00258 integer from_binary(const std::string& str) {
00259     try {
00260         return integer(core::from_binary(str));
00261     } catch (exception&) {
00262         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw;
00263         else return integer::nan();
00264     }
00265 }

00286 std::string to_binary(const integer& n) {
00287     try {
00288         return to_binary(core::integer(n));
00289     } catch (std::exception&) {
00290         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw;
00291         else return std::string();
00292     }
